content.description: A bit short, but a fun powerful problem starting with a good right hand hold in the lowest part of the crack and the left hand on a low sharp undercling feature. Pull on to the wall with difficulty and fire up to a large sloping shelf just below the lip. Stay tight then finish up on large holds to mantle.
content.location: This problem starts on the left side of the steep overhang of the boulder.

content.description: Start with the right hand high in the lowest section of the mouthy crack. Left-hand low on a bad undercling feature. Pull-on and cross-over to a good spot in the crack. Unwind out right to a large hold then finish up the lip for another move or two before topping out.
content.location: This climb starts on the leftside of the short overhang and climbs the diagonal crack out right into the topout of "Alluring Spine".

content.description: Sit-start right of the tree matched on the arete/ lip of the boulder. Pull onto the overhanging wall and make your way left and around the tree dab-free then finish up on large holds with a few tricky sequences to the apex of the boulder before topping out.
content.location: This is the first climb seen when walking towards the boulder from the Harry Potter Boulder.

content.description: This is a somewhat hidden boulder with some good but short moderates. There is a nice aesthetic arete/ lip traverse and also a neat overhanging crack.
